subject: Education
title: The Invention of the Alphabet: Phoenicia's Gift
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Invention of the Alphabet: Phoenicia's Gift.

hook.text: Around 1050 BCE, Phoenician traders invented something revolutionary: letters that represent sounds.

buildup.text: Before alphabets, writing systems like cuneiform needed hundreds or thousands of symbols to function.

discovery.text: The Phoenician alphabet used just 22 consonant symbolsâ€”simple enough for merchants to learn quickly.

twist.text: Greeks borrowed Phoenician letters and added vowelsâ€”creating the ancestor of almost every Western script.

climax.text: From Phoenician came Greek, Latin, Cyrillic, and Arabicâ€”scripts used by billions of people today.

punchline.text: Merchants needed to write invoices. They ended up writing history.

quiz.question: What was revolutionary about the Phoenician alphabet?
options: It used a small set of symbols representing sounds instead of meanings
It was the first writing system ever created
It could only be read by Phoenician priests
